slides.title: Content Calendar

content.headline: Never Wonder 'What Should I Post?' Again
content.subhead: Build a content calendar in 30 minutes

slides.narration: Staring at a blank screen wondering what to post is exhausting. A content calendar plans your content in advance so you always know what's coming. Let's build one that makes content creation effortless.

slides.title: What You'll Create
slides.narration: We'll define your content pillars—the themes you'll consistently cover. Set your posting schedule. Build a content ideas bank so you never run dry. And show you how to manage your calendar ongoing.

slides.title: Step 1: Define Content Pillars
slides.narration: Define three to five content pillars—themes you'll rotate through. Educational content: tips and how-tos. Behind-the-scenes: your story and process. Social proof: reviews and testimonials. Promotional: your offers and services. Community: local and seasonal content. Follow the eighty-twenty rule: eighty percent value, twenty percent promotion.

slides.title: Step 2: Set Schedule

content.consistency: Same days and times builds audience expectation

slides.narration: Set your posting schedule. Example: Monday is educational tip. Wednesday is behind-the-scenes. Friday is customer spotlight or promotion. Weekend is community content. Same days and times build audience expectation—they'll look for your content. Three to five posts per week is sustainable for most businesses.

slides.title: Step 3: Build Ideas Bank

content.tip: When you have an idea, write it down immediately

slides.narration: Build an ideas bank so you never run dry. Sources: customer questions you answer often, industry news and trends, seasonal and holiday tie-ins, behind-the-scenes moments, customer success stories, tips from your expertise. When you have an idea, write it down immediately. Keep a running list of fifty-plus ideas to pull from.

slides.title: Step 4: Plan and Schedule

process: Create or queue content in batches
content.batching: Create similar content together for efficiency

slides.narration: Plan and schedule content. Block one to two hours monthly for planning—non-negotiable. Assign ideas from your bank to calendar dates. Create content in batches—all your educational posts at once, all your behind-the-scenes at once. Leave some room for timely content that comes up. Batch creation is the efficiency secret.

slides.title: Pro Tips
slides.narration: Content calendar pro tips. Repurpose—one good idea becomes three to five posts across formats. Stay at least two weeks ahead in your schedule. Review monthly what performs best and create more of that. Don't delete good evergreen content—reschedule it for months later.

slides.title: Build Your Calendar
slides.narration: Ready to never wonder what to post again? Create your content calendar now. Or get content ideas for your industry first to fill your ideas bank. Planned content is stress-free content.
